intro: Brachyglottis cockaynei, commonly known as the coastal bristlebush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal environments, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. It is well adapted to salt spray and strong winds, making it a resilient species in harsh maritime conditions. Brachyglottis cockaynei plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for native wildlife.
